context: The Estonian verb 'sõita' means to drive or to travel by vehicle. It is the da-infinitive form of 'sõitma'. This word specifically refers to movement using some kind of motorized transportation like a car, bus, train, etc., rather than walking. The verb can be conjugated in different tenses: sõidan (I drive), sõidab (he/she/it drives), sõidame (we drive), sõitate (you plural drive), and the imperative form 'sõida' means 'drive!' or 'go!'.
